description: From Middle English impoverishen, empoverishen, from Old French empoverir, from em- + povre, from Latin pauper (“poor”) (English poor).

verbs.description: impoverish (third-person singular simple present impoverishes, present participle impoverishing, simple past and past participle impoverished)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To weaken in quality; to deprive of some strength or richness.
examples: That exuberant crop quickly impoverishes any fertile soil.
